function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through international transport networks","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of local mobility needs and conditions in transport policy","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for increased transmission of contagious diseases due to interconnectedness and interdependencies of everyday life.","category":"Social Expression","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Losing interest in news about covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Decreasing/diminished interest and avoidance of news about covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic fatigue leading to desensitization and avoidance of news about the pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Avoidance and denial of covid-19-related information leading to reduced compliance with public health measures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greater post-traumatic stress symptoms associated with decreasing interest in covid-19 news","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Prolonged exposure to negative news about covid-19 causing desensitization","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreasing burden of negative information about covid-19 in media may decrease stress but also public interest in covid-19 news.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Greater utilization of secondary interpersonal information sources like friends and relatives may increase the risk of covid-19 fatigue and decrease interest in pandemic news.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased reliance on healthcare professionals for covid-19 information may lead to greater trust in the information but could result in decreased public interest in pandemic news.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Selection bias in online survey due to majority of respondents being women and aged 40 years.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Decreasing interest and avoidance of news about covid-19 associated with specific demographic and psychological factors.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on wearable technology for health monitoring","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy and security risks with wearable technology data","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of wearables to detect covid-19 symptoms may lead to false positives or false negatives, resulting in incorrect diagnoses.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on wearables for early detection of infection may lead to privacy concerns, as biometric data and gps information are utilized for tracking and alerting individuals.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of wearables data could lead to an overreliance on the technology for decision-making, neglecting other important public health measures.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Machine learning approaches applied to wearable data could tease out signals of infection or disease states.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Users might not have the time or inclination to continually provide updated information from wearables and self-reported symptoms.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to monitor cognitive rest can lead to overexertion and symptom flare-ups for individuals with long covid.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in identifying when physical and mental exertion is beyond the individual’s capacity may lead to prolonged symptoms and setbacks.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of wearables to manage symptoms without professional medical oversight","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wearables accentuating anxiety over sleep habits","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concerns about more transmissible variants of covid-19 impacting efforts to suppress the spread of the disease.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New, more transmissible variants of the sars-cov-2 virus may require a review of current efforts to suppress the spread of covid-19.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in determining the risk and severity of infection based on viral exposure and deposition in the respiratory system","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Asymptomatic and pre-symptomatic transmission of the virus","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentrations of sars-cov-2 virus in oral fluids and upper respiratory tract symptoms at the early stage of infection.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of uncertainty in viral load associated with different aerosol sizes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Soap and water alone may not be effective at deactivating the virus on surfaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear guidance on social distancing indoors based on droplet transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on simplified models and assumptions may result in inaccurate assessment of social distancing requirements.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for directionality of respiratory events in layout design","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate social distancing recommendations based on assumptions about droplet behavior","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate use of face masks and coverings leading to increased transmission of covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate use or non-use of face masks in public spaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate wearing of face masks and coverings in areas with known or suspected community transmission of covid-19 virus","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate integration of face masks and coverings with other preventive measures such as social distancing and hand hygiene","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate source reduction and management of indoor events","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupancy levels not reduced leading to increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disturbance of air and dispersal of airborne aerosols due to movement of people within enclosed spaces.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"A cloud of infected aerosol may be mixed by the wakes of many people in spaces like supermarkets, increasing the risk of exposure to subsequent individuals.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dispersion of infected aerosol caused by people movement delays the effectiveness of ventilation in controlling contagious diseases in built environments.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The dispersal of contagious aerosol in buildings may lead to significant airborne transmission of diseases due to people movement, affecting individuals in the built environment.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High risk of exposure to small aerosols due to the movement of people in buildings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of people movement on the mixing and dispersal of small aerosols","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Movement of people leading to increased dispersal of co2 tracer and aerosols","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conflict between reducing airborne infection risk and maintaining thermal comfort and reducing energy consumption during colder periods.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
